org.ensor.algorithms.astar

Interface IMap<Mover extends IPathMover,Node extends IPathNode>

  • Type Parameters:
    Mover - This class represents the entity moving on the map.
    Node - This class represents a node in the map.
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    GridMap, GridMapCompassMoves, GridMapDiagonalMoves, HexMap

    public interface IMap<Mover extends IPathMover,Node extends IPathNode>
    This interface represents a map or graph to be traversed using the AStar algorithm. The map must implement a way to retrieve nodes adjacent to the current node (for the given mover) and must be able to determine if it is valid for a given mover to traverse the given node. In addition, the cost and heuristic measures must be implemented so that the relative cost of various path elements can be known so that the AStar algorithm will complete in a deterministic way.
    Author:
    Jon

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      double getCost(Mover mover, Node startNode, Node nextNode)
      This method returns the cost of the given mover traversing from the startNode to the nextNode (assumed to be adjacent nodes).
      double getHeuristic(Mover mover, Node startNode, Node nextNode)
      This method provides an estimate for the cost of a mover traversing from the startNode to the nextNode (not necessarily adjacent) in the map.
      Collection<Node> getNeighbors(Mover mover, Node node)
      The getNeighbors method must return a list of neighbors for the given node for the given mover.
      boolean isValid(Mover mover, Node node)
      This method determines whether the given mover can traverse the given node.

    • Method Detail

      • getNeighbors

        Collection<Node> getNeighbors(Mover mover,
                            Node node)
        The getNeighbors method must return a list of neighbors for the given node for the given mover. The method must operate in a reflexive way (i.e. there must be no one-way traversals) implied by this map. If there is an node "X" returned by this method for the node "Y" then then the node "Y" must be returned for the node "X".
        Parameters:
        mover - The entity moving on the map.
        node - The node on the map for which the neighbors should be found.
        Returns:
        The list of nodes immediately reachable by the mover directly from the given node.

      • isValid

        boolean isValid(Mover mover,
              Node node)
        This method determines whether the given mover can traverse the given node. The map, mover, and nodes can determine their own rules for determining whether this traversal is valid.
        Parameters:
        mover - The entity moving on the map.
        node - The node for which to test traversability.
        Returns:
        True if the mover is allowed to pass the given node.

      • getCost

        double getCost(Mover mover,
             Node startNode,
             Node nextNode)
        This method returns the cost of the given mover traversing from the startNode to the nextNode (assumed to be adjacent nodes). The scale and values of the costs are determined by the map and have only meaning relative to other costs. It is assumed that the cost of the overall path is the linear cost of each of the adjacent moves. It is also assumed that costs are independent of the order of traversal meaning that getCost(M, S, E) == getCost(M, E, S) must always be true.
        Parameters:
        mover - The entity moving on the map.
        startNode - The node from which to start.
        nextNode - The node on which to end.
        Returns:
        The cost of the given mover traversing from startNode to endNode on this map.

      • getHeuristic

        double getHeuristic(Mover mover,
                  Node startNode,
                  Node nextNode)
        This method provides an estimate for the cost of a mover traversing from the startNode to the nextNode (not necessarily adjacent) in the map. It is assumed that the costs are independent of the order of traversal meaning that getHeuristic(M, S, E) == getHeuristic(M, E, S) must always be true.
        Parameters:
        mover - The entity moving on the map.
        startNode - The node from which to start.
        nextNode - The end node for which to estimate cost.
        Returns:
        The estimated cost of traversing from the startNode to the endNode on this map.
